thread.title: Netball World Cup Live: Australian Diamonds vs New Zealand Silver Ferns, video, updates
thread.title_full: Netball World Cup Live: Australian Diamonds vs New Zealand Silver Ferns, video, updates | The Advertiser

author: Rebecca Williams NEWS CORP AUSTRALIA
title: Netball World Cup Live: Australian Diamonds vs New Zealand Silver Ferns, video, updates
text:
AUSTRALIA has suffered an early blow to its World Cup campaign after arch rivals New Zealand brought the Diamonds’ 21-game winning streak to an end in Sydney.
The Ferns had not beaten the Diamonds in nine previous matches heading into their early World Cup showdown today, but landed a crucial psychological advantage against the defending champions with their 52-47 win in front of a record crowd of 16,223 at Allphones Arena.
The loss means the Diamonds, who had won their opening two games against Trinidad and Tobago and Barbados, will now finish second in their pool A behind the Silver Ferns.
The Diamonds staged a fightback in the last quarter after trailing by as much as eight goals late in the third quarter, but were unable to run down their old foes.
Caitlin Bassett competes for a rebound with Casey Kopua and Katrina Grant. Source: AAP
The Diamonds will now have the first of two rest days during the World Cup on Monday before they are regrouped into another pool for the qualification matches.
Australia’s loss was marred by uncharacteristic errors and sloppy passing as the Silver Ferns were lead by a strong performance from goal attack Maria Tutaia, who shot 34 from 48 attempts and could have done more damage on the scoreboard if she had been more accurate.
Diamonds coach Lisa Alexander opened with a largely favoured starting line-up, with Sharni Layton getting the starting nod at goal defence instead of Julie Corletto.
The Silver Ferns made a shaky start, with Tutaia missing her first two shots at goal, allowing Caitlin Bassett to get the first score on the board for the Diamonds.
While Bassett struggled to find her position early against some tight checking from Silver Ferns defenders Casey Kopua and Katrina Grant, the Ferns were able to push ahead of the Diamonds in the opening quarter as were able to deliver plenty of ball to Tutaia.
Caitlin Bassett of the Diamonds competes with Casey Kopua. Source: Getty Images
New Zealand took a 15-12 lead into the first change and their lead could have been more had Tutaia’s accuracy been better than her quarter-time figures of nine from 15.
Alexander didn’t waste anytime making a change for the start of the second quarter, bringing Corletto on at goal defence.
Corletto threw her weight around in the goal circle to make her presence felt as the Diamonds levelled the scores early in the second quarter, but they were unable to push ahead of the persistent Silver Ferns, who pulled out to three-goal lead at halftime.
Alexander made more changes to her defence for the start of the second half, moving Corletto out to wing defence on Grace Rasmussen in place of Renae Hallinan and bringing Layton on at goal defence.
With Tutaia dominating and the Diamonds making some costly turnovers, the Ferns extended their lead to seven goals before the Diamonds called a time-out with nine minutes left in the quarter for Nat Medhurst to receive treatment on her shoulder.
Australia thumps Barbados by 67 goals 0:32 Play video
Netball: Australia thumped Barbados by 67 goals in their match at the Netball World Cup 2015.
Fox Sports 08 Aug 2015 News When play resumed, Erin Bell replaced Medhurst at goal attack, but the Silver Ferns charge continued as they stretched the lead out to eight goals, as they took advantage of some tidy midcourt work from Kayla Cullen.
A late run saw the Diamonds cut the margin to four goals at three-quarter time, with Alexander making just one more change for the start of the final quarter bringing on Paige Hadley at wing attack for Kim Green.
The Diamonds continued their fightback in the last quarter, but had ultimately left their charge too late.
Bassett topscored for the match with 38 goals from 43 attempts alongside Medhurst (6/7) in the first half and then Erin Bell (3/7).
Re-live all the action from the match in the live blog.
Netball World Cup 2015: Sharni's Diary Day 3 2:02 Play video
Netball: Sharni Layton presents the third edition of Sharni's Diary; a wrap up of Day 2 of the Netball World Cup.
Fox Sports 09 Aug 2015 News
NWC BROADCAST GUIDE
From August 7-16, Fox Sports Australia will be the only place to watch all 64 games of the Netball World Cup, with live and high definition coverage of all Diamonds, semi finals and medal games showcased on a dedicated 24/7 Netball World Cup channel on FOX SPORTS 505.
Online, FoxSports.com.au ’s World Cup section will be the ultimate destination for World Cup news before and during the tournament. As well as the latest video highlights from every match there will be a daily wrap of all games, live blogs of Australia’s games, and player rankings.
